title: How to Stream Disney+ on Discord Without a Black Screen

steps.title: Log into https://www.disneyplus.com/ in a web browser.
steps.content: Log into https://www.disneyplus.com/ in a web browser. It's recommended to use Google Chrome over other web browsers, as other browsers will show a black screen. You must have an active Disney+ subscription. If you have multiple profiles, select the one you want to use.

steps.title: Disable hardware acceleration in Google Chrome.
steps.content: Disable hardware acceleration in Google Chrome. To do this, go to the browser's settings and click on the System tab, then toggle off Use hardware acceleration when available or Use graphics acceleration when available .

steps.title: Navigate to a movie or show you want to watch.
steps.content: Navigate to a movie or show you want to watch. Use the search bar at the top of the page or select a category to browse the selection.

steps.title: Launch the Discord desktop app.
steps.content: Launch the Discord desktop app. Discord is available to download on Windows, Mac , and Linux. If you aren't already logged in, enter your email address and password to do so now. [1] X Research source You can also use Discord in a desktop browser at https://discord.com/ .

steps.title: Click .
steps.content: Click . This will be at the bottom-left corner, next to the Unmute and Deafen icons. A new window will open.

steps.title: Click Voice & Video.
steps.content: Click Voice & Video . You can find this underneath the Accessibility header in the left panel.

steps.title: Toggle off "Hardware Acceleration".
steps.content: Toggle off "Hardware Acceleration". This will be underneath the Advanced header. You may need to scroll to find this option.

steps.title: Click Registered Games.
steps.content: Click Registered Games . This will be underneath the Activity Settings header in the left panel.

steps.title: Click Add it!.
steps.content: Click Add it! . This will be in blue, next to Not seeing your game?

steps.title: Click the drop-down menu and select your browser.
steps.content: Click the drop-down menu and select your browser. In some cases, your browser will be named as your active tab.

steps.title: Click Add Game.
steps.content: Click Add Game . This is the blue button. Discord will register your browser as a game. Exit the window by pressing Esc on your keyboard or by clicking the X in the top-right corner.

steps.title: Navigate to a server.
steps.content: Navigate to a server. Use an existing server or create a new one for streaming movies and shows.

steps.title: Click the monitor icon.
steps.content: Click the monitor icon. You can find this above your username at the bottom-left. A pop-up window will open.

steps.title: Select your stream settings.
steps.content: Select your stream settings. You'll be able to choose the voice channel, resolution, and framerate. If you have Discord Nitro , you'll be able to stream in higher quality.

steps.title: Click Go Live.
steps.content: Click Go Live . This is the blue button on the bottom of the window. Your stream will begin. You can wait for other users to join your stream.

steps.title: On your web browser, click play on your video.
steps.content: On your web browser, click play on your video. Your video will begin streaming to your Discord server. If you're having trouble streaming, try to refresh discord . Close the program fully, and then open it again.
